00001 <h2>Instructions</h2>
00002 <p>
00003         Drop PHPQuickReference into ~/Library/Widgets (that's the Library folder located in your home folder, preferred) or /Library/Widgets.
00004         Activate Dashboard, drag the widget to your screen and enjoy!
00005 </p>
00006 
00007 <h3>Hints</h3>
00008 <p>
00009         PHPQuickReference is smart enough to save you a lot of time figuring out
00010         the names of functions. If you type <strong>my</strong>, the widget will suggest
00011         <strong>mysql</strong>. If you follow typing <strong>mysql_co</strong> the
00012         widget will suggest <strong>mysql_connect</strong>.
00013 </p>
00014 <p class="centered">
00015         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/phpquickreference/autocompletion.png" alt="Autocompletion" />
00016 </p>
00017 <p>
00018         If you typed a string that is a valid function name, you'll see it in <span style="color:green;font-weight:bold">green</span>.
00019         Thus you know that you can safely hit ENTER to fetch the reference. If you see the string in <span style="color:red;font-weight:bold">red</span>,
00020         you'll know at a glance that there's no PHP function with that prefix, so you'd better delete and try again.
00021 </p>
00022 
00023 <h3>Autocompletion</h3>
00024 <p>
00025         Hit TAB to cycle through all matching function names for a given prefix.
00026         For example, if you digit <strong>array_s</strong> and then hit TAB you'll
00027         get in the order <strong>array_sum</strong>, <strong>array_search</strong>,
00028         <strong>array_shift</strong>, <strong>array_slice</strong>, <strong>array_splice</strong>.
00029 </p>
